s.text: "Unfortunately, the Legal Services Corp. that's in existence now is dedicated to political activism and leftist causes, and, sometimes, the representation of the poor," said Todd Gaziano, senior fellow in legal studies at the Washington-based Heritage Foundation.
Washington --- The organization that pays for legal representation for the poor could be in trouble.

"Unfortunately, the Legal Services Corp. that's in existence now is dedicated to political activism and leftist causes, and, sometimes, the representation of the poor," said Todd Gaziano, senior fellow in legal studies at the Washington-based Heritage Foundation.
Washington --- The organization that pays for legal representation for the poor could be in trouble.
Barr sharpening ax on legal aid to poor
Washington --- The organization that pays for legal representation for the poor could be in trouble.
Barr thinks the private, Washington-based non-profit organization, which pays local groups to represent the poor, is not doing business the way it should.
Washington --- The organization that pays for legal representation for the poor could be in trouble.
It is run by an 11member board appointed by the president and confirmed by the Senate.
No more than six members of the bipartisan board can be from any one political party.
No more than six members of the bipartisan board can be from any one political party.
President Bush is expected to name new board members soon, and Barr said he would like to have an effect on those appointments.

He has asked the General Accounting Office to conduct a probe.
